title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
This board had some liquid damaged but not too bad and the LCD connector was butned on pins 3/4 I have removed the connector. I get a green light but it doesn't turn on. When the battery was plugged in the charger light would turn orange so the battery is being recognized

Here is a list of areas that had any liquid damage before I put flux and heated those components. I have not put it in the ultrasonic yet.
q7055
u7201
c7012
l6995 area
j5700 tpad connector
c7050 r7052 area of isl6259
pin 3 u5402
u7870
r5127 area(SPI_ALT_MOSI)
Q9302
q7330/35
u7840
c7012/13 were burned and replaced

I first replaced r7051/52 & C7050 and the pad on Pin 1 of R7051 was gone and there was no continuity from Pin2 of c7050 to Probe 556 so I ran a wire from C7050 to Pin 1 of R7051 & Probe 556.
That still didn't solve the issue so I replaced the ISL6259 and still same issue.
Resistance Pins 17/18 - 2.9ohms Pins 27/28 - 20.8ohms

U7201 had some liquid damage but no components look badly damaged. Here are some voltages of U7201
Pin 23(VIN) - 8.4v
Pin 22(VREG3) - 3.3v
Pin 29(VREG5) - 5.02v
Pin 12 - 0v
Pin 4 - 0v
Pin 21 - 3.51v
R7251 has 0v on both sides.
R7813 also 0v on both sides. (PM_SLP_S4_L)


I shorted the power pads next to the tpad connector and measured SMC_ONOFF_L going down to 0v and it still didn't turn on.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
"Pin 12 - 0v
...
Pin 21 - 3.51v"
This not possible, unless you have corroded trace; or did wrong measurement...
Look at schematic, check U7840 area. It should have same voltage at pins 2/3.

Also measure resistance to ground at L6995, in 200K scale.
You know, should be higher than 30K.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
I didn't push my probe all the way into the pin. Pin 12 is actually 3.43v. Pin 2 of U7840 is 3.43v and Pin 3 is 3.51v

L6995 in 200k scale if I did correct shows around 66Kohms

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
Threw this in the ultrasonic and I shorted the power pads and the fan spun so it looks good. I will get some sleep, test everything together and update later today.

Update: Everything is working fine now.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
I did an ASD OS test and it is telling me the Current(ID0R) DC IN sensor is reading below the low point.
I took an I/O Board+Cable from a 2011 MBA that passed the ID0R sensor test and I plugged it into this machine and that sensor still failed.

R5481 and the surronding SMC area look spotless and the resistance measured fine. I believe it was measuring somewhere around 0.35v in voltage mode

In EFI version here is the hardware profile reading.

Low-Limit: 0.1A
High-Limit: 3.29A
Description: Current Sensor DCIN 0 Rail AMON
Reading 0.04A

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
I got a ID0R reading from a working 2011 MBA that passed the sensor test and this is what it showed on the hardware profile.
Low-Limit: 0.0A
High Limit: 3.5A
Reading: 0.000A

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
What has the IO board to do with this, please explain? 

This is of course an issue with the current sense circuits on the ISL6259.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
When I say DC-In I assumed that was the IO issue.
Pins 17/18 + 27/28 measure proper resistance. (2.9ohms & 20.7ohms)
I did do some repairs on Pins 17/18 as stated previously. I'm not sure if that is causing issues.

"(I replaced r7051/52 & C7050 and the pad on Pin 1 of R7051 was gone and there was no continuity from Pin2 of c7050 to Probe 556 so I ran a wire from C7050 to Pin 1 of R7051 & Probe 556)"

There is continuty all the way from pins 17/18 to the current sensing resistors.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message: Something is fucked in the current sense circuit. It is up to you what is wrong. Maybe wire is wrong or something.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message:
Okay I made a foolish mistake I was running the test without the charger plugged in. I plugged the charger in and did the test and it Passed this time.

Thanks.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message: I ran the test again with the charger plugged in and it passed and the reading on ID0R was 2.1A. I removed the charger and did the test again and the reading showed 0.04A and failed.

title: 820-2838 not turning on (no s3 voltages)
message: Yes, your current sensing circuit is not good.
